content.description:
This is a really cool slab problem on perfect rock.   

  Start on the main face, and get thin feet down low and whatever works for hands.  Once established on main face, work over to arete where you will encounter a hold or two.  Continue up using a combination of the arete for hands and the main face for feet until you can reach the only decent hold at the top.   

  This is a perfect combination of arete and slab problem that could only be improved by being longer.
content.protection: Pad.  The landing is excellent but the nearby tree should provoke your interest.
content.location: This starts on the left side of the main face of STD slab about 3-4 feet right of the tree. The starting foot hold was originally buried by leaf litter at the base.

content.description:
Start in the middle of the face under the okay looking crimp about 8-10 feet up.   Elf, ninja, wizard, or ferret your way up to this hold and beyond.  

  The crux is probably getting to the hold, which is not as good as looks from the ground.   The grade is likely height-dependent.   

  It is funnest on a hot, humid day.
content.protection: Pad.  Falls are clean but sudden.
content.location: It is roughly in the middle/ right middle of STD slab.   Look for the crimpy hold a few feet from the top.

content.description:
This is a face climb on slightly overhanging rock so it's a stand out in the South Dome friction scene.    

  Sit start with hands matched on the shallow, left-facing flake, then traverse up and right to yonder jug via two crimps.  Top out from the jug, which is easier than it looks (especially if I can do it).  Using the face to the far right is considered ungentlemanly.
content.protection: A Pad helps.  There are nasty rocks nearby, but they are not quite in the fall zone.
content.location: This traverses up and across the small, overhanging face around the right arete of the STD slab.  The starting hold is almost on the arete.

content.description: Climb the right-slanting finger crack in the left center corner of the crag.
content.location: This is in the corner around the far right arete of STD slab to the right of "Skin Doom."

content.description: This is the easiest line on the STD slab.  Step up on to the rising flake on the right side of the slab, and head more or less using the shallow horizontal above as a hand hold.  This is still a little licheny.
content.protection: The landing is generally good, but look out for the nasty looking flake to the right.
content.location: It is on the right side of STD slab.

content.description: This is a really nice little slab with few features and good moderate friction problems.  It's a little shadier than the other other sections of the main area, but it still nice and open.
